questions.question: What is the client's business model?
Which tracking platforms will be used?

events.description: Triggered automatically when a user FIRST LAUNCHES the mobile app

properties.name: build
properties.definition: the build number of the installed app

events.description: Triggered when a user launches or foregrounds the app after the first open

properties.name: build
properties.definition: the build number of the installed app

properties.name: from_background
properties.definition: If application transitioned from “Background” to “Inactive” state prior to foregrounding (as opposed to from “Not Running” state).

properties.name: referring_application
properties.definition: The value of UIApplicationLaunchOptionsSourceApplicationKey from launchOptions. Automatically collected on iOS only.

properties.name: url
properties.definition: The value of UIApplicationLaunchOptionsURLKey from launchOptions.Collected on iOS only.

events.description: Triggered when a user when a user updates the app

properties.name: build
properties.definition: the build number of the installed app

events.description: Triggered when a user views page listing blog posts from a particular category/topic

properties.name: blog_category
properties.definition: category of blog topics one is viewing

events.description: Triggered when a user views a blog post

properties.name: blog_category
properties.definition: category of blog topics one is viewing

properties.name: blog_post_author
properties.definition: author of the blog post viewed

properties.name: blog_post_title
properties.definition: title of the blog post viewed

properties.name: gclid
properties.definition: url of the blog post viewed

events.description: Triggered when a user views their cart

properties.name: gclid
properties.definition: Array value of products displayed in the product list

properties.name: products.$.category
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

events.description: Triggered when a user initiated the order process (a transaction is created)

properties.name: affiliation
properties.definition: store or affiliation from which this transaction occurred (e.g. Google Store)

properties.name: coupon
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

properties.name: discount
properties.definition: total discount associated with the transaction

properties.name: gclid
properties.definition: order/transaction id, must use of of these property names for ad platforms

properties.name: order_id
properties.definition: Array value of products displayed in the product list

properties.name: products.$.category
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

properties.name: products.$.variant
properties.definition: total value of product after quantity

events.description: Triggered when a user completes a checkout step

properties.name: gclid
properties.definition: selection for "How did you hear about us?"

properties.name: phone_shipping
properties.definition: Boolean True if yes is selected, False if not

properties.name: step_name
properties.definition: number representing a step in the checkout process

events.description: Triggered when a user clicks a CTA button on a page

properties.name: destination
properties.definition: generally a URL destination of clicking the link

properties.name: location
properties.definition: if possible, the location of the button (e.g. module name)

properties.name: type
properties.definition: the type of CTA {button, interstitial, banner}

events.description: Triggered provided by deep link providers or an internal redirect service if you use one in order to provide a waypoint funnel step between your content or advertisement and the resulting app open. This event may be automatically collected by the iOS library if you opt in.

properties.name: provider
properties.definition: The deep link or attribution provider.

properties.name: url
properties.definition: The App URL opened or clicked

events.description: Triggered when your application is opened via a referring link, Segment or your packaged deep link partner will fire this event on your behalf.

properties.name: provider
properties.definition: The deep link or attribution provider.

properties.name: url
properties.definition: The App URL opened or clicked

properties.name: email_id

events.description: Triggered when Segment listener receives notice from client's email tool server that an email recipient clicked on a link in an email’s body

properties.name: campaign_id
properties.definition: an id used to identify a campaign

properties.name: campaign_name
properties.definition: a name used to identify a campaign

properties.name: email_id
properties.definition: an ID used to identify the email.

properties.name: link_id
properties.definition: an id used to identify a link

properties.name: link_url
properties.definition: the URL the link points to

properties.definition: an id used to identify a campaign

properties.name: campaign_name

events.description: Triggered when the client's email tool receives noticed from the email server that a recipient has marked an email as spam

events.description: Triggered by an Segment listener via the Optimizely or VWO destination that indicate a user has viewed an experiment

properties.name: experiment_name
properties.definition: descriptive experiment name- ideally includes date ranges

events.description: Triggered when Segment or an integrated partner can discern the source of an install

properties.name: campaign[medium]
properties.definition: Identifies what type of link was used.

properties.name: campaign[name]
properties.definition: The name of the attributed campaign.

properties.name: provider
properties.definition: The deep link or attribution provider.

events.description: Triggered when a user successfully submits an lead form fill
Triggered when a user's order is cancelled

properties.name: affiliation
properties.definition: store or affiliation from which this transaction occurred (e.g. Google Store)

properties.name: discount
properties.definition: total discount associated with the transaction

properties.name: order_id
properties.definition: order/transaction id, must use of of these property names for ad platforms

properties.name: products.$.coupon
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

properties.name: shipping
properties.definition: shipping cost associated with the transaction

properties.name: tax
properties.definition: total tax associated with the transaction

properties.name: total
properties.definition: revenue ($) with discounts and coupons added in. For better flexibility and total control over tracking, we let you decide how to calculate how coupons and discounts are applied

events.description: Triggered when a user successfully completes a transaction and the payment gateway returns a success call validating that the payment went through

properties.name: affiliation
properties.definition: store or affiliation from which this transaction occurred (e.g. Google Store)

properties.name: coupon
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

properties.name: discount
properties.definition: total discount associated with the transaction

properties.name: gclid
properties.definition: order/transaction id, must use of of these property names for ad platforms

properties.name: order_id
properties.definition: string representing the payment method chosen

properties.name: products.$.category
properties.definition: coupon code associated with a product (e.g MAY DEALS 3)

properties.name: products.$.variant
properties.definition: revenue ($) associated with the transaction (excluding shipping and tax)

properties.name: revenue
properties.definition: revenue ($) associated with the transaction (excluding shipping and tax)

properties.name: revenue_client
properties.definition: shipping cost associated with the transaction

properties.name: shipping
properties.definition: string representing the shipping method chosen

properties.name: shipping_method
properties.definition: order total after discounts but before taxes and shipping

properties.name: subtotal
properties.definition: total tax associated with the transaction

properties.name: tax
properties.definition: revenue ($) with discounts and coupons added in. For better flexibility and total control over tracking, we let you decide how to calculate how coupons and discounts are applied

properties.name: revenue

properties.name: revenue_client
properties.definition: revenue ($) associated with the transaction (excluding shipping and tax)

properties.name: total
properties.definition: revenue ($) with discounts and coupons added in. For better flexibility and total control over tracking, we let you decide how to calculate how coupons and discounts are applied

events.description: Triggered when a user loads a page

properties.name: path
properties.definition: path portion of the URL of the page (equivalent to canonical path which defaults to location.pathname from the DOM API) (autocaptured)

properties.name: referrer
properties.definition: full URL of the previous page (equivalent to document.referrer from the DOM API) (autocaptured as previous page)

properties.name: search
properties.definition: query string portion of the URL of the page (equivalent to location.search from the DOM API)

properties.name: title
properties.definition: title of the page (equivalent to document.title from the DOM API)

events.description: Triggered on behalf of a user when their payment attempt is declined by the payment gateway

properties.name: plan_billing_amount
properties.definition: The recurring billing amount for the subscription plan

properties.name: plan_code
properties.definition: If there is a code for the subscription, the value for that code

properties.name: plan_name
properties.definition: A property communicating the plan name/type in the payment processor

properties.name: plan_status
properties.definition: The state of the plan (e.g. active, past due, cancelled, etc.)

events.description: Triggered when a user completes their customer billing info in the checkout process

properties.name: affiliation
properties.definition: store or affiliation from which this transaction occurred (e.g. Google Store)

properties.name: order_id
properties.definition: order/transaction id, must use of of these property names for ad platforms

events.description: Triggered when a user adds a product to their shopping cart

properties.name: image_url
properties.definition: Boolean for if product added is from its own page or added along with another product

properties.name: name
properties.definition: verbiage for offer on product (e.g. Save $x)

properties.name: quantity
properties.definition: size of the product (e.g. King, Queen)

properties.name: url
properties.definition: total value of product after quantity

properties.name: variant
properties.definition: wishlist id to which the product was added to

properties.name: wishlist_id
properties.definition: wishlist name to which the product was added to

properties.name: wishlist_name

events.description: Triggered when a push notification from a provider bounces. If your push notification provider forwards push lifecycle events to Segment, they should include this event in their suite.
Triggered when a user a push notification is received by your mobile app. This event may be automatically collected by the iOS library if you opt in.
Triggered when when a user taps on a push notification associated with your app. This event may be automatically collected by the iOS library if you opt in.
Auto-triggered by the Segment snippet when a user sees a screen. Alternatively, may be called as a Track event to normalize screen names across platforms
Triggered when a user clicks and is redirected to one of the search results from a search query

properties.name: location
properties.definition: indicates if the result was selected from autofill or the search results page

events.description: Triggered when a user successfully signs up for a trial

properties.definition: The trial expiration date (in ISO-8601 date string)

events.description: Triggered when a user's trial period expires

Triggered when the client's email tool receives noticed that the recipient has unsubscribed from the email. The unsubscription can either happen for a particular list, or globally from all marketing emails, depending on the tool. Typically you cannot unsubscribe from a transactional email such as a password reset

events.description: Not recommended for main taxonomy - option to implement if team insists on tracking more clicks than CTAs
